ArticleTitle.sentence: T cell priming enhances IL-4 gene expression by increasing nuclear factor of activated T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: The repetitive activation of T cells (priming) enhances the expression of many cytokines, such as IL-4, but not others, such as IL-2.

AbstractText.sentence: Molecular mechanisms underlying selective expression of cytokines by T cells remain poorly understood.

event.clue: Molecular mechanisms underlying selective expression of cytokines by T cells remain poorly understood.

AbstractText.sentence: Here we show that priming of CD4 T cells selectively enhances IL-4 expression relative to IL-2 expression by a transcriptional mechanism involving nuclear factor of activated T cells (NFAT) proteins.

event.clue: Here we show that priming of CD4 T cells selectively enhances IL-4 expression relative to IL-2 expression by a transcriptional mechanism involving nuclear factor of activated T cells (NFAT) proteins.

AbstractText.sentence: As detected by in vivo footprinting, priming markedly increases the activation-dependent engagement of the P0 and P1 NFAT-binding elements of the IL-4 promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: Moreover, each proximal P element is essential for optimal IL-4 promoter activity.

AbstractText.sentence: Activated primed CD4 T cells contain more NFAT1 and support greater NFAT-directed transcription than unprimed CD4 T cells, while activator protein 1 binding and activator protein 1-mediated transcription by both cell types is similar.

AbstractText.sentence: Increased expression of wild-type NFAT1 substantially increases IL-4 promoter activity in unprimed CD4 T cells, suggesting NFAT1 may be limiting for IL-4 gene expression in this cell type.

event.clue: Increased expression of wild-type NFAT1 substantially increases IL-4 promoter activity in unprimed CD4 T cells, suggesting NFAT1 may be limiting for IL-4 gene expression in this cell type.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, a truncated form of NFAT1 acts as a dominant-negative, reducing IL-4 promoter activity in primed CD4 T cells and confirming the importance of endogenous NFAT to increased IL-4 gene expression by effector T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: NFAT1 appears to be the major NFAT family member responsible for the initial increased expression of IL-4 by primed CD4 T cells.
